Q_DESC:
Magic Squares are interested things. Ramya and Ratha played together in a ground. Suddenly Ratha gave a task to ramya to form a magic square. But she cant form if the number is even. Help her to do this work.
The 3x3 magic square is the earliest known magic square. It dates back to Chinese mythology, you can read the story here.

People normally say there is only one 3x3 magic square. In one sense this is true, in another it is not. It is true because all the 3x3 magic squares are related by symmetry. Once you have one, you can get all the others by turning or flipping the one you found.
This is a trick one can perform on any magic square. Just add the same number x to all of the entries and you obtain a square with equal row, column, and diagonal sums. These sums will be obtained by adding nx to the corresponding values for the original square.
